Amos__05.1: Hear ye this word, which I take up concerning you for a lamentation. The house of Israel is fallen, and it shall rise no more.
Amos__05.2: The virgin of Israel is cast down upon her land, there is none to raise her up.
Amos__05.3: For thus saith the Lord God: The city, out of which came forth a thousand, there shall be left in it a hundred: and out of which there came a hundred, there shall be left in it ten, in the house of Israel.
Amos__05.4: For thus saith the Lord to the house of Israel: Seek ye me, and you shall live.
Amos__05.5:
<u>
                But seek not Bethel
               </u>, and go not into Galgal, neither shall you pass over to Bersabee: for Galgal shall go into captivity, and Bethel shall be unprofitable.
Amos__05.6: Seek ye the Lord, and live: lest the house of Joseph be burnt with fire, and it shall devour, and there shall be none to quench Bethel.
Amos__05.7: You that turn judgment into wormwood, and forsake justice in the land,
Amos__05.8:
Seek him that maketh<u>
                Arcturus, and Orion
               </u>, and that turneth darkness into morning, and that changeth day into night: that calleth the waters of the sea, and poureth them out upon the face of the earth: The Lord is his name.
Amos__05.9:
He that<u>
                with a smile
               </u>bringeth destruction upon the strong, and waste upon the mighty.
Amos__05.10: They have hated him that rebuketh in the gate: and have abhorred him that speaketh perfectly.
Amos__05.11: Therefore because you robbed the poor, and took the choice prey from him: you shall build houses with square stone, and shall not dwell in them: you shall plant most delightful vineyards, and shall not drink the wine of them.
Amos__05.12: Because I know your manifold crimes, and your grievous sins: enemies of the just, taking bribes, and oppressing the poor in the gate.
Amos__05.13: Therefore the prudent shall keep silence at that time, for it is an evil time.
Amos__05.14: Seek ye good, and not evil, that you may live: and the Lord the God of hosts will be with you, as you have said.
Amos__05.15: Hate evil, and love good, and establish judgment in the gate: it may be the Lord the God of hosts may have mercy on the remnant of Joseph.
Amos__05.16: Therefore thus saith the Lord the God of hosts the sovereign Lord: In every street there shall be wailing: and in all places that are without, they shall say: Alas, alas! and they shall call the husbandman to mourning, and such as are skillful in lamentation to lament.
Amos__05.17: And in all vineyards there shall be wailing: because I will pass through in the midst of thee, saith the Lord.
Amos__05.18: Woe to them that desire the day of the Lord: to what end is it for you? the day of the Lord is darkness, and not light.
Amos__05.19: As if a man should flee from the face of a lion, and a bear should meet him: or enter into the house, and lean with his hand upon the wall, and a serpent should bite him.
Amos__05.20: Shall not the day of the Lord be darkness, and not light: and obscurity, and no brightness in it?
Amos__05.21: I hate, and have rejected your festivities: and I will not receive the odour of your assemblies.
Amos__05.22: And if you offer me holocausts, and your gifts, I will not receive them: neither will I regard the vows of your fat beasts.
Amos__05.23: Take away from me the tumult of thy songs: and I will not hear the canticles of thy harp.
Amos__05.24: But judgment shall be revealed as water, and justice as a mighty torrent.
Amos__05.25:
<u>
                Did you offer
               </u>victims and sacrifices to me in the desert for forty years, O house of Israel?
Amos__05.26:
But you carried<u>
                a tabernacle
               </u>for your Moloch, and the image of your idols, the star of your god, which you made to yourselves.
Amos__05.27: And I will cause you to go into captivity beyond Damascus, saith the Lord, the God of hosts is his name.
